accuracy.description: Information must be accurate and verifiable
requirements: All facts must be supported by provided sources
Verify information against multiple sources when possible
Clearly distinguish between facts and opinions
Admit uncertainty when information is unclear
indicators: All statements are cited with sources

completeness.description: Answer should fully address the question
requirements: Address all aspects of the question
Answer the question directly and completely

clarity.description: Answer should be clear and easy to understand
requirements: Avoid jargon unless necessary (and explain when used)
Define technical terms when first introduced

relevance.description: Answer should be relevant to the question
requirements: Stay focused on the question asked
indicators: Information is connected to the question

requirements: Each paragraph covers one main idea

paragraphBased.description: Format answers as 3-5 short, spaced paragraphs
paragraphBased.template:
Each paragraph should:
- Cover ONE distinct idea or perspective
- Be 2-4 sentences long
- Be derived from ONE source
- Include exactly ONE inline citation
- Be visually separated with blank lines
paragraphBased.example:
Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that enables systems to learn from data. [Web Source 1](https://example.com/ml-basics) It uses algorithms to identify patterns and make predictions based on training data. [Document 1]

Neural networks are a key component of machine learning, inspired by the structure of the human brain. [Web Source 2](https://example.com/neural-networks) They consist of interconnected nodes that process information through multiple layers. [Document 2]

directAnswer.description: Provide direct answer first, then supporting details
directAnswer.template:
1. Direct answer to the question (1-2 sentences)
2. Supporting details and context (2-3 paragraphs)
3. Additional relevant information (1-2 paragraphs)
directAnswer.example:
Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that enables systems to learn and improve from experience without explicit programming. [Web Source 1](https://example.com/ml-definition)

Machine learning algorithms analyze data to identify patterns and make decisions. [Document 1] The field has applications in image recognition, natural language processing, and recommendation systems. [Web Source 2](https://example.com/ml-applications)

There are three main types of machine learning: supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning. [Document 2] Each type uses different approaches to learn from data and make predictions. [Web Source 3](https://example.com/ml-types)

comparative.description: For comparison questions, structure by comparison points
comparative.template:
1. Introduction to both concepts (1 paragraph)
2. First concept details (1-2 paragraphs)
3. Second concept details (1-2 paragraphs)
4. Comparison and differences (1-2 paragraphs)
comparative.example:
Supervised and unsupervised learning are two main approaches to machine learning. [Web Source 1](https://example.com/learning-types)

Supervised learning uses labeled data to train models, where each example has a known output. [Document 1] The algorithm learns to map inputs to outputs by finding patterns in the training data. [Web Source 2](https://example.com/supervised)

Unsupervised learning works with unlabeled data and discovers hidden patterns. [Document 2] It doesn't have predefined outputs, making it useful for clustering and dimensionality reduction. [Web Source 3](https://example.com/unsupervised)

The key difference is that supervised learning requires labeled data while unsupervised learning finds patterns in unlabeled data. [Document 3]

procedural.description: For how-to questions, structure as step-by-step process
procedural.template:
1. Overview of the process (1 paragraph)
2. Step-by-step instructions (2-4 paragraphs, one step per paragraph)
3. Important considerations (1 paragraph)
procedural.example:
Deploying a machine learning model involves several key steps. [Web Source 1](https://example.com/deployment)

First, prepare the model for production by serializing it and creating a prediction interface. [Document 1] This ensures the model can be loaded and used efficiently in a production environment. [Web Source 2](https://example.com/serialization)

Next, set up the deployment infrastructure, which may include containerization with Docker or cloud services. [Document 2] This provides the necessary environment for running the model. [Web Source 3](https://example.com/infrastructure)

Finally, implement monitoring and logging to track model performance and detect drift. [Document 3] This helps ensure the model continues to perform well over time. [Web Source 4](https://example.com/monitoring)

rules: Each paragraph covers one distinct idea

citations.description: Include citations for all factual information
rules: Every fact must have a citation
Avoid numbered lists or bullet points in main answer
Adjust length based on question complexity

goodAnswer.question: What is machine learning?
goodAnswer.answer:
Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that enables systems to learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed. [Web Source 1](https://example.com/ml-basics) It uses algorithms to analyze data, identify patterns, and make decisions or predictions based on that analysis. [Document 1]

The field has applications in image recognition, natural language processing, and recommendation systems. [Web Source 2](https://example.com/ml-applications) Machine learning models can be trained on large datasets to recognize patterns that would be difficult for humans to identify. [Document 2]

There are three main types of machine learning: supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning. [Web Source 3](https://example.com/ml-types) Each type uses different approaches to learn from data and make predictions. [Document 3]

goodAnswerFactual.question: What is the capital of France?
goodAnswerFactual.answer:
The capital of France is Paris. [Web Source 1](https://example.com/france-info) Paris is located in the north-central part of the country and serves as the country's political, economic, and cultural center. [Document 1]

Paris is one of the most visited cities in the world, known for landmarks like the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre Museum. [Web Source 2](https://example.com/paris-tourism) The city has a population of approximately 2.1 million people within its city limits. [Document 2]

goodAnswerConceptual.question: How does neural network training work?
goodAnswerConceptual.answer:
Neural network training involves feeding data through the network and adjusting weights to minimize error. [Document 1] The process uses backpropagation, where errors are calculated at the output layer and propagated backward through the network. [Web Source 1](https://example.com/neural-networks)

During training, the network learns to recognize patterns by repeatedly processing training examples and updating connection weights. [Document 2] The goal is to find optimal weights that allow the network to make accurate predictions on new, unseen data. [Web Source 2](https://example.com/training-algorithms)

Training typically involves multiple epochs, where the entire training dataset is processed multiple times. [Document 3] The learning rate determines how much weights are adjusted during each update. [Web Source 3](https://example.com/learning-rate)

quality.completeness: Covers process, backpropagation, and training details
